isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1997) - SECTION 3.5: CIRCUIT FUNCTION AND DIAGNOSTICS - KEEP ALIVE MEMORY POWER AND VPM BATTERY POWER CIRCUIT - ECM KAM AND VPM BATTERY POWER EXTENDED SYSTEM DESCRIPTION

svcproc.title: ECM KAM AND VPM BATTERY POWER EXTENDED SYSTEM DESCRIPTION
svcproc.para:
Refer to circuit diagram ( Figure 3.135 and 3.136
) for the following discussion.

The ECM Keep Alive Memory (KAM) circuit 97J provides battery power from the Positive battery terminal through ECM connector 379 to ECM terminal 1 at all times. The circuit is protected by 15 amp, #1 ECM PWR Fuse, which also supplies power to the VPM, VBAT terminal (8). KAM stores fault codes and operating constants between engine starts.
